results.title: The Cabbage-Patch Fairy
results.brief_description: La Fée aux Choux (The Cabbage-Patch Fairy) is considered the first fictional film with a scripted narrative. It was created by trailblazing French filmmaker Alice Guy-Blaché, who returned to the story numerous time early in her career.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.description: La Fée aux Choux (The Cabbage Fairy, 1896) is considered the first fictional film with a scripted narrative. It was created by trailblazing French filmmaker Alice Guy-Blaché. It’s a brief fantasy tale involving a strange fairy who can produce and deliver babies coming out of cabbages, like the classic fairy tale. Some think The Cabbage-Patch Fairy is a lost film, but it’s so similar to Guy Blaché’s later works, others believe it never existed.
description_for_label: La Fée aux Choux (The Cabbage Fairy, 1896) is considered the first fictional film with a scripted narrative. It was created by trailblazing French filmmaker Alice Guy-Blaché. It’s a brief fantasy tale involving a strange fairy who can produce and deliver babies coming out of cabbages, like the classic fairy tale. Some think The Cabbage-Patch Fairy is a lost film, but it’s so similar to Guy Blaché’s later works, others believe it never existed.

results.title: The Broadway Melody
results.brief_description: Love and success break up a vaudeville sister act, when a love triangle between Harriet, Queenie and Eddie forms the crux of this Oscar winning musical.

constellations_other.name: Boom mics, Clara Bow and musicals
constellations_other.description: The microphone was called the "terror of the studios" when sound films were introduced in the late 1920s, but after initial resistance Hollywood fully embraced the new technology.

results.description: The vaudeville act of Harriet and Queenie Mahoney comes to Broadway, where their friend Eddie Kerns needs them for his number in one of Francis Zanfield’s shows. When Eddie meets Queenie, he soon falls in love with her—but she is already being courted by Jock Warriner, a member of New York high society. Queenie eventually recognises that, to Jock, she is nothing more than a toy, and that Eddie is in love with her.
description_for_label: The vaudeville act of Harriet and Queenie Mahoney comes to Broadway, where their friend Eddie Kerns needs them for his number in one of Francis Zanfield’s shows. When Eddie meets Queenie, he soon falls in love with her—but she is already being courted by Jock Warriner, a member of New York high society. Queenie eventually recognises that, to Jock, she is nothing more than a toy, and that Eddie is in love with her.

results.title: The Boys from Brazil
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1978
results.brief_description: Nazi hunter Ezra Lieberman discovers a sinister and bizarre plot to rekindle the Third Reich.

constellations_other.name: Undercutting extremism with absurdity
constellations_other.description: Taika Waititi's satirical performance as Adolf Hitler in Jojo Rabbit connects to a number of other portrayals that includes ill-fated (and conceived) TV shows, memes, high camp and cinema classics.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1978
results.description: Nazi hunter Ezra Lieberman discovers a sinister and bizarre plot to rekindle the Third Reich.
description_for_label: Nazi hunter Ezra Lieberman discovers a sinister and bizarre plot to rekindle the Third Reich.

results.title: The Boxtrolls
results.creator_credit: Laika Entertainment, Irena Brignull, Paul Lasaine, Anthony Stacchi, Travis Knight, Adam Pava, Graham Annable, David Bleiman Ichioka, August Hall, Deborah Cook, Michel Breton and Tom McClure
results.brief_description: An orphaned boy raised by underground creatures called Boxtrolls comes up from the sewers and out of his box to save his family and the town from the evil exterminator, Archibald Snatcher.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laika Entertainment, Irena Brignull, Paul Lasaine, Anthony Stacchi, Travis Knight, Adam Pava, Graham Annable, David Bleiman Ichioka, August Hall, Deborah Cook, Michel Breton and Tom McClure
results.description: An orphaned boy raised by underground creatures called Boxtrolls comes up from the sewers and out of his box to save his family and the town from the evil exterminator, Archibald Snatcher.
description_for_label: An orphaned boy raised by underground creatures called Boxtrolls comes up from the sewers and out of his box to save his family and the town from the evil exterminator, Archibald Snatcher.

results.title: The Boston Strangler
results.brief_description: Boston is being terrorized by a series of seemingly random murders of women. Based on the true story, the film follows the investigators path through several leads before introducing the Strangler as a character. It is seen almost exclusively from the point of view of the investigators who have very few clues to build a case upon.

constellations_other.name: Lois Weber and the split-screen
constellations_other.description: Lois Weber was the third filmmaker to use split screens to show simultaneous action, helping establish it as part of cinematic language, particularly its use in thrillers. It's since been taken to extremes by auteurs and videogames.

results.description: Boston is being terrorized by a series of seemingly random murders of women. Based on the true story, the film follows the investigators path through several leads before introducing the Strangler as a character. It is seen almost exclusively from the point of view of the investigators who have very few clues to build a case upon.
description_for_label: Boston is being terrorized by a series of seemingly random murders of women. Based on the true story, the film follows the investigators path through several leads before introducing the Strangler as a character. It is seen almost exclusively from the point of view of the investigators who have very few clues to build a case upon.

results.title: The Blue Planet
results.brief_description: David Attenborough narrates a natural history of the oceans.

constellations_primary.name: Deep blue
constellations_primary.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

results.description: David Attenborough narrates a natural history of the oceans.
description_for_label: David Attenborough narrates a natural history of the oceans.

results.title: The Blue Angel
results.creator_credit: UFA, Erich Pommer, Josef von Sternberg, Carl Zuckmayer, Carl Winston, Karl Vollmöller, Robert Liebmann, Tihamer Varady and Emil Hasler
results.brief_description: Prim professor Immanuel Rath finds some of his students ogling photos of cabaret performer Lola Lola and visits a local club, The Blue Angel, to catch them there. When the teacher himself falls for Lola Lola, life becomes difficult.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

results.creator_credit_for_label: UFA, Erich Pommer, Josef von Sternberg, Carl Zuckmayer, Carl Winston, Karl Vollmöller, Robert Liebmann, Tihamer Varady and Emil Hasler
results.description: Prim professor Immanuel Rath finds some of his students ogling racy photos of cabaret performer Lola Lola and visits a local club, The Blue Angel, in an attempt to catch them there. Seeing Lola perform, the teacher is filled with lust, eventually resigning his position at the school to marry the young woman. However, his marriage to a coquette — whose job is to entice men — proves to be more difficult than Rath imagined.
description_for_label: Prim professor Immanuel Rath finds some of his students ogling racy photos of cabaret performer Lola Lola and visits a local club, The Blue Angel, in an attempt to catch them there. Seeing Lola perform, the teacher is filled with lust, eventually resigning his position at the school to marry the young woman. However, his marriage to a coquette — whose job is to entice men — proves to be more difficult than Rath imagined.

results.title: The Blair Witch Project
results.brief_description: In October of 1994 three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, while shooting a documentary. A year later their footage was found.

constellations_other.name: Home movies, fiction and reality blurred
constellations_other.description: The accessibility and portability of cameras has had a big impact on how we see ourselves and the world. As camera technology continues to evolve, so do our ways of seeing, with the line between reality and fiction disappearing.

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

constellations_other.name: Making home movies
constellations_other.description: Home movies have inspired the form and plots of narrative cinema.

recommendations.quote: Not only did The Blair Witch Project scare up $248.6 million USD at the box office, it also created the first viral marketing campaign (which led many people to believe it was true) and ushered in the era of hand-held doco-style found footage horror films.

results.description: In October of 1994 three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, while shooting a documentary. A year later their footage was found.
description_for_label: In October of 1994 three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, while shooting a documentary. A year later their footage was found.

results.title: The Birdcage
results.brief_description: A gay cabaret owner and his drag queen companion agree to put up a false straight front so that their son can introduce them to his fiancé’s conservative moralistic parents.
results.description: A gay cabaret owner and his drag queen companion agree to put up a false straight front so that their son can introduce them to his fiancé’s conservative moralistic parents.
description_for_label: A gay cabaret owner and his drag queen companion agree to put up a false straight front so that their son can introduce them to his fiancé’s conservative moralistic parents.

results.title: The Bigamist
results.brief_description: Harry Graham and his wife Eve are adopting a child. When PI Jordan uncovers that Graham has another wife and a small child in LA, he confesses. In flashback, Graham recounts the strains in his marriage and how he fell for the kind-hearted Phyllis.

constellations_other.name: Analogue and digital film
constellations_other.description: Though technology has evolved since celluloid film strips were invented, contemporary filmmakers and artists still appreciate and celebrate the analogue in a digital world.

results.description: A woman discovers her husband has another family in another city.
description_for_label: A woman discovers her husband has another family in another city.
